Line 17: Line 17:
==Politics==
==Politics==
On June 22, 2011, John Noseworthy announced via [[Twitter]] that he was retiring from his position as Auditor General effective July 31, 2011, 13 months before his 10 year term as Auditor General was up.<ref>{{cite news|title=Noseworthy retiring as auditor general|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador/story/2011/06/22/nl-noseworthy-ag-retires-622.html|accessdate=16 August 2011|newspaper=Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|date=22 June 2011}}</ref> His name was brought up as a candidate for the leadership of the [[Liberal Party of Newfoundland and Labrador]] upon the resignation of [[Yvonne Jones]], but on August 8, 2011 he announced he was offered the job of Liberal leader but declined. On August 16, 2011, he announced he was seeking the [[Progressive Conservative Party of Newfoundland and Labrador|Progressive Conservative Party]] nomination in the district of [[Signal Hill-Quidi Vidi]] for the [[Newfoundland and Labrador general election, 2011|October 2011 provincial election]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Noseworthy plans Tory run against NDP leader|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador/story/2011/08/16/nl-noseworthy-tories-nomination-816.html|accessdate=16 August 2011|newspaper=Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|date=16 August 2011}}</ref> On August 19, he was acclaimed as the party's candidate for the district, which is currently held by [[New Democratic Party of Newfoundland and Labrador|New Democratic Party]] leader [[Lorraine Michael]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Former AG to challenge NDP leader in N.L. election|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador/story/2011/08/19/nl-ag-ndp-819.html|accessdate=20 August 2011|newspaper=Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|date=19 August 2011}}</ref>
On June 22, 2011, John Noseworthy announced via [[Twitter]] that he was retiring from his position as Auditor General effective July 31, 2011, 13 months before his 10 year term as Auditor General was up.<ref>{{cite news|title=Noseworthy retiring as auditor general|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador/story/2011/06/22/nl-noseworthy-ag-retires-622.html|accessdate=16 August 2011|newspaper=Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|date=22 June 2011}}</ref> His name was brought up as a candidate for the leadership of the [[Liberal Party of Newfoundland and Labrador]] upon the resignation of [[Yvonne Jones]], but on August 8, 2011 he announced he was offered the job of Liberal leader but declined. On August 16, 2011, he announced he was seeking the [[Progressive Conservative Party of Newfoundland and Labrador|Progressive Conservative Party]] nomination in the district of [[Signal Hill-Quidi Vidi]] for the [[Newfoundland and Labrador general election, 2011|October 2011 provincial election]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Noseworthy plans Tory run against NDP leader|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador/story/2011/08/16/nl-noseworthy-tories-nomination-816.html|accessdate=16 August 2011|newspaper=Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|date=16 August 2011}}</ref> On August 19, he was acclaimed as the party's candidate for the district, which is currently held by [[New Democratic Party of Newfoundland and Labrador|New Democratic Party]] leader [[Lorraine Michael]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Former AG to challenge NDP leader in N.L. election|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador/story/2011/08/19/nl-ag-ndp-819.html|accessdate=20 August 2011|newspaper=Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|date=19 August 2011}}</ref>
â   â
:Is this for real? This is the first I heard of this, and while I'm surprised to read this, I'm also elated beyond belief. Finally a star that can help rid the province of the NDP once-and-for-all. What do you people think of this? Can he win a seat, or is he just a flash-in-the-pan of Newfoundland politics? Later friends.[[User:Born a Newfoundlander|Born a Newfoundlander]] ([[User talk:Born a Newfoundlander|talk]]) 06:25, 20 August 2011 (UTC)
  â   â
Wikipedia isn't some message board for discussing the election, it's an online encyclopedia, so plase refrain from adding comments directly to the text of this or any other article.
